page.title: 10Trade in Edinburgh
page.content: Princes Street is Edinburgh's main shopping area. Many chain stores{trade there. The Waverley Market represents the new style of shopping in the eighties. It is made up of small units under one roof and the plants and fountains give a relaxed atmosphere. People can hire barrows for a month at a time to sell their{arts and crafts. Many of the shops in the centre reflect people's changing{attitudes} e.g. the Body Shop sells cosmetics tested without cruelty and the Marathon Shop caters for the ever increasing{recreation}of jogging and marathon running. The Waverley Market won an award for its shop fronts, mirrored walls and beautiful fountains. It is situated at ground level so that the view to the High Street is not interrupted. { }
